Definition: An individual; usually a human being.
A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider’s feet upon pedals.
A wheeled vehicle that moves independently, with at least three wheels, powered mechanically, steered by a driver and mostly for personal transportation.
An open-seated motor vehicle with handlebars instead of a steering wheel, and having two (or sometimes three) wheels.
A powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings.
A motor vehicle for transporting large numbers of people along roads.
Elongated portion.
A small wheel or roller, specifically the wheel of a gun carriage.
A craft used for transportation of goods, fishing, racing, recreational cruising, or military use on or in the water, propelled by oars or outboard motor or inboard motor or by wind.
A signalling device positioned at a road intersection or pedestrian crossing to indicate when it may be safe to drive, ride or walk, using a universal colour code.
A device used by firefighters to obtain water from the main supply, consisting of a barrel, connections for hose and a valve assembly.
No definition found
A device, located by a parking space, that collects payment in exchange for the right to park a vehicle for a specified time.
A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.
A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs.
An animal of the family Felidae:
A mammal, Canis familiaris or Canis lupus familiaris, that has been domesticated for thousands of years, of highly variable appearance due to human breeding.
Any of several animals related to Equus ferus caballus.
A woolly ruminant of the genus Ovis.
(properly) An adult female of the species Bos taurus, especially one that has calved.
A mammal of the order Proboscidea, having a trunk, and two large ivory tusks jutting from the upper jaw.
A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae.
Any of three species of genus Equus: E. grevyi, E. quagga, or E. zebra, all with black and white stripes and native to Africa.

A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.

A knapsack, sometimes mounted on a light frame, but always supported by straps, worn on a person’s back for the purpose of carrying things, especially when hiking, or on a student's back when carrying books.
Cloth-covered frame used for protection against rain or sun.
(mainly Commonwealth) A small bag used by women (or sometimes by men) for carrying various small personal items.
A knot; a fastening.
A large (usually rectangular) piece of luggage used for carrying clothes, and sometimes suits, when travelling.
A disk-shaped gliding toy.
One of a pair of long flat runners designed for gliding over snow or water
A board, somewhat like a broad ski, or a very long skateboard with no wheels, used in the sport of snowboarding.
No definition found
No definition found
No definition found
No definition found
A narrow, wooden or plastic platform mounted on pairs of wheels, on which one stands and propels oneself by pushing along the ground with one foot.
A shaped waterproof plank, usually made of wood or foam and reinforced plastic, used to surf on waves.
No definition found
A container, typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.
A glass vessel, normally with a stem, from which wine is drunk.
A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass) and with a handle.
A pronged tool having a long straight handle, used for digging, lifting, throwing etc.

A utensil or a tool designed for cutting, consisting of a flat piece of hard material, usually steel or other metal (the blade), usually sharpened on one edge, attached to a handle. The blade may be pointed for piercing.
An implement for eating or serving; a scooped utensil whose long handle is straight, in contrast to a ladle.
A roughly hemispherical container used to hold, mix or present food, such as salad, fruit or soup, or other items.
An elongated curved tropical fruit that grows in bunches and has a creamy flesh and a smooth skin.
A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates.
A dish or foodstuff where two or more slices of bread serve as the wrapper or container of some other food.
An evergreen tree of the genus Citrus such as Citrus sinensis.
A plant, Brassica oleracea var. italica, of the cabbage family, Brassicaceae; especially, the tree-shaped flower and stalk that are eaten as a vegetable.
A vegetable with a nutritious, juicy, sweet root that is often orange in colour, Daucus carota, especially the subspecies sativus in the family Apiaceae.
A sandwich consisting of a frankfurter, or wiener, in a bread roll, usually served with ketchup, mustard, relish, etc.
A baked Italian dish of a thinly rolled bread dough crust typically topped before baking with tomato sauce, cheese and other ingredients such as meat, vegetables or fruit
A deep-fried piece of dough or batter, commonly made in a toroidal or ellipsoidal shape, and mixed with various sweeteners and flavors, sometimes filled with jelly, custard or cream.
A rich, sweet dessert food, typically made of flour, sugar and eggs and baked in an oven, and often covered in icing.
An item of furniture used to sit on or in, comprising a seat, legs, back, and sometimes arm rests, for use by one person. Compare stool, couch, sofa, settee, loveseat and bench.
Couch grass, a species of persistent grass, Elymus repens, usually considered a weed.
No definition found
A piece of furniture, usually flat and soft, on which to rest or sleep.
A table, usually in a dining room, on which meals are served.
A covering of linen, silk, or tapestry, spread over a dressing table in a chamber or dressing room.
The assessed value of an asset from which the tax owing is computed.
A laptop computer.
Any small rodent of the genus Mus.
An element of broadcast programming originating away from the station's or show's control room.
(etc.) A set of keys used to operate a typewriter, computer etc.
A portable, wireless telephone, which changes antenna connections seamlessly during travel from one radio reception cell to another without losing the party-to-party call connection.
An electromagnetic wave with wavelength between that of infrared light and radio waves.
A chamber used for baking or heating.
One who toasts (cooks lightly by browning).
A basin used for holding water for washing.
A household appliance used for keeping food fresh by refrigeration (short form fridge).
A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc.
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.
An upright open container used mainly for displaying fresh, dried, or artificial flowers.
One blade on a pair of scissors.
A plush toy in the shape of a bear.
No definition found
A brush, used with toothpaste, for cleaning the teeth.
